definition: to engage with secular society/to involve oneself in human affairs/to join the WTO (abbr. for 加入世界貿易組織|加入世界贸易组织[jia1 ru4 Shi4 jie4 Mao4 yi4 Zu3 zhi1])
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]
surname Shi
life/age/generation/era/world/lifetime/epoch/descendant/noble

sentences.english: This gave the Chinese people a better sense of balance in regard to this-worldlincss and other- worldliness .
sentences.chinese: 这使得中国人对于入世和出世具有良好的平衡感。

sentences.english: Chapter two studied the content of Liu Chang's poem, and learnt the positive and negative thought showed in his poems.
sentences.chinese: 第二章通过刘敞诗歌内容分析其出世精神与入世情怀。

sentences.english: After Chinas entering WTO, the international market has been further opened to Chinas agricultural and livestock products.
sentences.chinese: 入世后，我国农畜产品进入国际市场的大门已经敞开。

sentences.english: His this-worldly idea was abundant and integrated, and the contour of the otherworldly idea was also formed.
sentences.chinese: 其入世思想丰富完整，出世思想也初具轮廓。

sentences.english: Thought , aspiration that judging from Confucian learning, he has to go into the society actively become an official.
sentences.chinese: 从儒家思想上看，他有积极入世的思想，渴望出仕。

sentences.english: We should use the buffer period to make bet…
sentences.chinese: 充分利用缓冲期，做好入世准备。

sentences.english: We should use the buffer period to make better preparat…
sentences.chinese: 充分利用缓冲期，做好入世准备。

sentences.english: It is a tendency to open up this trade.
sentences.chinese: 入世后，开放我国律师业已是大势所趋。

sentences.english: In an initial stage of joining the WTO, various trades in China will be effected differently.
sentences.chinese: 入世初期，中国各行业所受影响是苦乐不均的。

sentences.english: Among others, the Confucianism culture is re-accepted for its practice.
sentences.chinese: 其中，儒家文化以其入世的实用性被重新接受。

sentences.english: Another way the WTO has helped limit protection is through accession agreements.
sentences.chinese: 世界贸易组织限制保护主义的另一个渠道是入世协定。

definition: the vulgar world (Buddhist concept)/secular world
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
to practice Daoism
profane/secular/worldly
to achieve the Dao/to become an immortal
Buddhism/Buddhist
see 看破[kan4 po4]
mundane world
Zen Buddhism
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
lay (as opposed to clergy)/ordinary/commonplace
Buddha-like heart (full of compassion)/spirit of Buddha (awakened to reality and no longer clinging to appearances)
worldly affairs/the ways of the world
the Daoist doctrine of inaction/let things take their own course/laissez-faire
Wuwei county in Chaohu 巢湖[Chao2 hu2], Anhui
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
to enter the Way/to become a Daoist
